root.DebateTimingRubric: Bishop’s Stortford Cemetery Bill [Lords]: Third Reading

from_cdata.p: No debate, and may not be proceeded with if opposed (Standing Order No. 20).

MotionText.from_cdata: Bill to require specified organisations and public bodies to inform children and young people of local, national and online support services available to them following a bereavement; and for connected purposes.

root.Heading3Underlined: Personal Protective Equipment at Work (Protected Characteristics)

span.style: mso-ascii-font-family: Calibri; mso-ascii-theme-font: minor-latin; mso-hansi-font-family: Calibri; mso-hansi-theme-font: minor-latin; mso-bidi-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-bidi-theme-font: minor-bidi;

p.span: Bill to require employers to ensure that personal protective equipment provided at work to people with certain protected characteristics within the meaning of the Equality Act 2010 is suitable for the wearer; and for connected purposes.

root.BusinessItemHeadingNumbered: Public Sector Websites (Data Charges): Ten Minute Rule Motion

MotionText.from_cdata: That leave be given to bring in a Bill to require providers of electronic communications networks to allow their customers to access certain public sector websites free of charge; and for connected purposes.

from_cdata.p: The Member moving and a Member opposing this Motion may each speak for up to 10 minutes.

root.BusinessItemHeadingNumbered: WAYS AND MEANS: ADJOURNED DEBATE ON QUESTION [11 MARCH]

MotionText.from_cdata: 1. Income tax (charge) That income tax is charged for the tax year 2024-25. And it is declared that it is expedient in the public interest that this Resolution should have statutory effect under the provisions of the Provisional Collection of Taxes Act 1968.

span.style: color: #333333; font-family: 'helvetica neue', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 14px;

p.span: For the remaining Budget Motions, numbers 2 to 25, and the associated Money Motion, see separate paper. Those motions will be decided without further debate at the conclusion of the Budget debate, immediately after the decision on the motion before the House on Income tax (charge) (Standing Order No. 51(3)).

MotionText.from_cdata: That the draft Representation of the People (Variation of Election Expenses and Exclusions) Regulations 2024, which were laid before this House on 29 January, be approved.

from_cdata.p: If this item is opposed after 7.00pm, the division will be deferred.

MotionText.from_cdata: That the draft General Aviation (Persons on Board, Flight Information and Civil Penalties) Regulations 2024, which were laid before this House on 28 November 2023, be approved.

from_cdata.p: If this item is opposed after 7.00pm, the division will be deferred.
If this item is opposed after 7.00pm, the division will be deferred.

MotionText.from_cdata: That the draft Single Source Contract (Amendment) Regulations 2024, which were laid before this House on 22 January, be approved.

from_cdata.p: If this item is opposed after 7.00pm, the division will be deferred.
If this item is opposed after 7.00pm, the division will be deferred.

MotionText.from_cdata: That the draft Criminal Justice Act 2003 (Suitability for Fixed Term Recall) Order 2024, which was laid before this House on 22 February, be approved.

span.style: color: #4d4d4d; font-family: National, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 16px;

p.span: The Instrument has not yet been considered by the Joint Committee on Statutory Instruments.

span.style: color: #4d4d4d; font-family: National, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 16px;

p.span: If this item is opposed after 7.00pm, the division will be deferred.

root.DebateTimingRubric: No debate or decision (Standing Order No. 153)
root.MotionText: Recommendations of the Infected Blood Inquiry: Dame Diana Johnson
root.DebateTimingRubric: Until 7.30pm or for half an hour (whichever is later) (Standing Order No. 9(7))
root.MotionText: Provision of inclusive personal protective equipment: Emma Hardy
root.DebateTimingRubric: The first part of the sitting will last for two hours. The second part of the sitting will last for three hours (Standing Order No. 10(1)).
root.MotionText: That this House has considered compensation for women affected by state pension changes: Jim Shannon

from_cdata.p: The subject for this debate was determined by the Backbench Business Committee.

root.MotionText: That this House has considered social housing occupancy levels: Catherine West

from_cdata.p: The sitting will be suspended from 11.30am to 2.30pm.
